issue.title: Impossible to turn off projectors using universal remotes
issue.body:
### Describe the bug.

The problem is that a lot of projectors require to press Power button twice in a short period of time (5-10 seconds) to be turned off. It is impossible to do so using universal remote with normal projectors.ir list because there each signal is listed only once. Restarting bruteforce will just cause projector timeout if the correct signal is not at the very beginning of the list. I tried duplicating every Power signal in projectors.ir and it solved the problem. I would be glad if you included list with doubled Power signals into firmware.

### Reproduction

1. Point flipper at a working projector
2. Go to universal remotes->projectors
3. Press Power button
4. At about 60% progress projector shows a message asking to press Power again
5. If I let flipper to continue, there is no more fitting signals
6. If I restart the process, it takes too long to reach the correct signal
7. After 10 seconds the message disappears and the projector stays on

### Target

_No response_

### Logs

_No response_

### Anything else?

[projectors.zip](https://github.com/flipperdevices/flipperzero-firmware/files/12586181/projectors.zip)
Here is my list with doubled Power signals and a program that I wrote to make it.

comment.body: @skotopes maybe this problem can be solved with the following features for a universal remote control: when you press the send button during the bruteforce of signals, the bruteforce should not start from the beginning, but, for example, roll back N signals (let's say N = 10). this functionality will not only solve this problem, but will also allow you to effectively control the volume and channels in tv.ir

If you will have any further info please post it there.

issue.title: NFC: Certain DESFire cards cannot be read
issue.body:
### Describe the bug.

According to @noproto's data, two MF DESFire EV2 cards cannot be read. Attempting to read them also leads to application abnormal behaviour.

Original posts:
- [First mention](https://github.com/flipperdevices/flipperzero-firmware/pull/3050#issuecomment-1752125993)
- [Logs with additional debug output](https://github.com/flipperdevices/flipperzero-firmware/pull/3050#issuecomment-1771718606)
- [Proxmark logs](https://github.com/flipperdevices/flipperzero-firmware/pull/3050#issuecomment-1774233772)

More info is available in the of #3050 discussion thread.

### Reproduction

The bug could not be reproduced by any of the devs.

### Target

_No response_

### Logs

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

issue.title: Hitag

labels.name: New Feature
labels.description: Contains an IMPLEMENTATION of a new feature

issue.body:
# What's new

- Included support for RTF (Reader Talks First) mode in RFID app, both for read & emulate modes.
- Included the Hitag1 protocol as first RTF protocol (more to come later, like Hitag2, HitagS) supporting read & emulate of public non encrypted pages 
- Updated the RFID scenes & views accordingly
- Updated the RFID key file save & load functions, by adding 'Hitag1 specific data' after the general section (fully backwards compatible with existing keys)

# Verification 

- Run RFID app and read/emulate/save/view/edit any of the already supported protocols
- Run RFID app and read/emulate/save a new Hitag1 card 
- Run RFID app and emulate/view/edit a saved Hitag1 card (sample key files for verification are added below)
[sampleHitag1.zip](https://github.com/flipperdevices/flipperzero-firmware/files/11441497/sampleHitag1.zip)

# Checklist (For Reviewer)

- [ ] PR has description of feature/bug or link to Confluence/Jira task
- [ ] Description contains actions to verify feature/bugfix
- [ ] I've built this code, uploaded it to the device and verified feature/bugfix

comment.body:
and some good news on emulation model:
emulation mode is back to normal result times (eg reader manages to read the full emulated tag in +/- 5s)

not sure if this is due to moving low level code to furi_rfid_hal or due to other changes elsewhere in firmware, but it's a nice extra :)
